book.title: How to Code
book.notes: A beginner's guide to creating amazing software that works.

book.title: Cooking with Computers: Surreptitious Balance Sheets
book.notes: Helpful hints on how to use your electronic resources to the best advantage.

book.title: You Can Combat Computer Stress!
book.notes: The latest medical and psychological techniques for living with the electronic office. Easy-to-understand explanations.

book.title: Straight Talk About Computers
book.notes: Annotated analysis of what computers can do for you: a no-hype guide for the critical user.

book.title: Silicon Valley Gastronomic Treats
book.notes: Favorite recipes for quick, easy, and elegant meals.

book.title: The Gourmet Microwave
book.notes: Traditional French gourmet recipes adapted for modern microwave cooking.

book.title: But Is It User Friendly?
book.notes: A survey of software for the naive user, focusing on the 'friendliness' of each.

book.title: Secrets of Silicon Valley
book.notes: Muckraking reporting on the world's largest computer hardware and software manufacturers.

book.title: Computer Phobic AND Non-Phobic Individuals: Behavior Variations
book.notes: A must for the specialist, this book examines the difference between those who hate and fear computers and those who don't.

book.title: Is Anger the Enemy?
book.notes: Carefully researched study of the effects of strong emotions on the body. Metabolic charts included.

book.title: Life Without Fear
book.notes: New exercise, meditation, and nutritional techniques that can reduce the shock of daily interactions. Popular audience. Sample menus included, exercise video available separately.

book.title: Prolonged Data Deprivation: Four Case Studies
book.notes: What happens when the data runs dry? Searching evaluations of information-shortage effects.

book.title: Emotional Security: A New Algorithm
book.notes: Protecting yourself and your loved ones from undue emotional stress in the modern world. Use of computer and nutritional aids emphasized.

book.title: Onions, Leeks, and Garlic: Cooking Secrets of the Mediterranean
book.notes: Profusely illustrated in color, this makes a wonderful gift book for a cuisine-oriented friend.

book.title: Fifty Years in Buckingham Palace Kitchens
book.notes: More anecdotes from the Queen's favorite cook describing life among English royalty. Recipes, techniques, tender vignettes.

book.title: Sushi, Anyone?
book.notes: Detailed instructions on how to make authentic Japanese sushi in your spare time.
